what: Access datasets of Brazilian Samba Schools and color palettes in R
title: Access datasets of Brazilian Samba Schools and color palettes in R
text: Carnaval biggest street feast Brazil. happens country kaleidoscope sound color. One many shapes yearly competition Samba Schools Rio. carnaval package provides easy access datasets competition color palettes inspired carioca Samba Schools. package focuses main league competition (“Grupo Especial”). Currently, data comes Galeria Samba portal. like package, please help keeping project afloat: Contribua. package development functions: get_scores: Obtain scores samba schools year, school /criterion. Data goes back since 1968; get_remarks: Obtain remarks evaluation process. Data goes back since 1968; get_parades: Obtain total scores () samba schools year /school. Data goes back since 1932; display_all: Plots available Samba School palettes; scale_ARG_rio_TYPE: Family ggplot functions plotting Samba School palettes. Can used fill color/colour (ARG) discrete (d) continuous (c) scales (TYPE); colorblind_friendly: Indicates whether palette friendly towards types colorblindness. Script builds palettes inspired MetBrewer package. Colorblindness performance checked using colorblindcheck.

title: Access datasets of Brazilian Samba Schools and color palettes in R
text: Install carnaval GitHub follows:
code: if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("IcaroBernardes/carnaval")

title: Access datasets of Brazilian Samba Schools and color palettes in R
code: # Loads the package library(carnaval)  # Prints a table that shows the scores of Portela and # Estácio de Sá on the parades of 1968 and 1970 on all criterions get_scores(years = c(1968, 1970), schools = c("portela", "Estácio de Sá")) #> # A tibble: 52 × 6 #>    school         year score criteria                 judge_name         judge…¹ #>    <chr>         <dbl> <dbl> <chr>                    <chr>              <glue>  #>  1 Estácio de Sá  1968     6 ALEGORIAS E ADEREÇOS     Napoleão Muniz Fr… judge1  #>  2 Portela        1968    10 ALEGORIAS E ADEREÇOS     Napoleão Muniz Fr… judge1  #>  3 Estácio de Sá  1968     7 BATERIA                  João de Barros  B… judge1  #>  4 Portela        1968     9 BATERIA                  João de Barros  B… judge1  #>  5 Estácio de Sá  1968     7 COMISSÃO DE FRENTE       Danúbio Menezes G… judge1  #>  6 Portela        1968     9 COMISSÃO DE FRENTE       Danúbio Menezes G… judge1  #>  7 Estácio de Sá  1968     4 CONJUNTO                 Ítalo de Oliveira  judge1  #>  8 Portela        1968     4 CONJUNTO                 Ítalo de Oliveira  judge1  #>  9 Estácio de Sá  1968     4 DESFILE NÃO INTERROMPIDO Maurício Shermann  judge1  #> 10 Estácio de Sá  1968     2 DESFILE NÃO INTERROMPIDO Sandra Dicken      judge2  #> # … with 42 more rows, and abbreviated variable name ¹​judge_number # Loads ggplot2 library(ggplot2)  # Gets the scores of Império Serrano from 1968 until 2018 on the Bateria criterion. # Throws some warnings to inform the user which years are absent of the data # (either from missing info or because the school didn't compete in the main league) df <- get_scores(years = 1968:2018, schools = "Império Serrano", criterions = "BATERIA")  # Creates a plot and applies manually the palette of Império Serrano ggplot(data = df, aes(x = judge_number, y = score, fill = judge_number)) +   geom_violin() +   scale_fill_manual(values = rio_paletter("Imperio_Serrano", 5))

title: Access datasets of Brazilian Samba Schools and color palettes in R
text: package created Ícaro Bernardes. hex logo created Bruno Mioto. Bruno also gave many tips made building package easier.

title: Complete list of palettes — RioPalettes
text: Use names(RioPalettes) return possible palette names. Current choices : Beija_Flor, Grande_Rio, Imperatriz_Leopoldinense, Imperio_Serrano, Mangueira, Padre_Miguel, Paraiso_Tuiuti, Portela, Salgueiro, Sao_Clemente, Tijuca, Uniao_Ilha, Vila_Isabel, Viradouro. Use rio_paletter construct palettes.

title: Complete list of palettes — RioPalettes
code: RioPalettes

title: Complete list of palettes — RioPalettes
text: object class list length 14.

title: Colorblind-Friendly Palette Check — colorblind_friendly
text: Checks whether palette colorblind-friendly. Colorblind-friendliness tested using colorblindcheck package. possible check palette friendly towards deuteranopia, protanopia, /tritanopia.

title: Colorblind-Friendly Palette Check — colorblind_friendly
code: colorblind_friendly(palette_name, type = "all")

title: Colorblind-Friendly Palette Check — colorblind_friendly
text: palette_name Name Palette. Choices : Beija_Flor, Grande_Rio, Imperatriz_Leopoldinense, Imperio_Serrano, Mangueira, Padre_Miguel, Paraiso_Tuiuti, Portela, Salgueiro, Sao_Clemente, Tijuca, Uniao_Ilha, Vila_Isabel, Viradouro. type kind colorblindness check. Deuteranopia, protanopia, /tritanopia

title: Colorblind-Friendly Palette Check — colorblind_friendly
text: TRUE/FALSE value whether palette colorblind-friendly

title: Colorblind-Friendly Palette Check — colorblind_friendly
code: colorblind_friendly("Imperio_Serrano", type = "tritanopia") #> Imperio_Serrano  #>            TRUE

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
text: Function viewing palettes available RioPaletter.

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
code: display_all(   n,   sequential = FALSE,   colorblind_support = "none",   direction = 1,   override.order = FALSE )

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
text: n Number requested colors. n left blank, default palette returned. sequential palettes displayed , one time. Default (FALSE). colorblind_support type colorblind friendliness returned palettes . Default "none". direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed override.order Colors picked palette maximize readability aesthetics. means colors always selected sequential order full palette. override.order set TRUE, colors selected sequential order full palette instead. Default FALSE.

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
code: # All palettes display_all(sequential = FALSE, colorblind_support = "none")   # All palettes that are protanopia and deuteranopia-friendly display_all(sequential = FALSE, colorblind_support = c("protanopia","deuteranopia"))   # 5 Colors of all Palettes display_all(5, sequential = FALSE, colorblind_support = "none")

what: Obtain total scores (and more) of samba schools by year and/or school — get_parades
title: Obtain total scores (and more) of samba schools by year and/or school — get_parades
text: get_parades() returns tibble total scores samba schools. can filtered year /school

title: Obtain total scores (and more) of samba schools by year and/or school — get_parades
code: get_parades(years, schools = "all")

title: Obtain total scores (and more) of samba schools by year and/or school — get_parades
text: years (numeric) years parade show. almost years since 1932 available. schools (character) samba schools show. Case insensitive.

title: Obtain total scores (and more) of samba schools by year and/or school — get_parades
text: tibble. columns school (samba school name), year (parade year), school_total (samba school total score), school_rank (samba school parade rank), school_remarks (remarks samba school parade), parade_location (samba school parade location), parade_date (samba school parade date), parade_order (samba school parade order), parade_manager (parade manager), theme (samba school parade theme). line corresponds total scores parade info school given year.

title: Obtain total scores (and more) of samba schools by year and/or school — get_parades
text: tibble confusing entries. One reasons: competition changed lot course decades perceived fluctuating number schools, years multiple competitions held, competitions ties rank (criteria break ). Another reason plain errors. Many entries missing data. highlighted "Enredo não registrado" "Resultado desfile não registrado". Total scores may diverge final rank assessment errors. issues rare low severity, meaning data reliable. Although, one pay attention parades remarks dataset get_remarks() order get better grasp happenings given year.

title: Obtain total scores (and more) of samba schools by year and/or school — get_parades
code: # Prints a table that shows the total scores and parade info of Portela and # Estácio de Sá on the parades of 1968 and 1970 get_parades(years = c(1968, 1970), schools = c("portela", "Estácio de Sá")) #> # A tibble: 4 × 10 #>   school      year schoo…¹ schoo…² schoo…³ parad…⁴ parad…⁵ parad…⁶ parad…⁷ theme #>   <chr>      <int>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>   <chr> #> 1 Portela     1968     103       4 Grupo 1 Candel… 25/02/…       5 AESEG … O tr… #> 2 Estácio d…  1968      79       7 Grupo 1 Candel… 25/02/…       2 AESEG … Uma … #> 3 Portela     1970      88       1 Grupo 1 Candel… 08/02/…      10 AESEG … Lend… #> 4 Estácio d…  1970      72       7 Grupo 1 Candel… 08/02/…       5 AESEG … Terr… #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​school_total, ²​school_rank, #> #   ³​school_remarks, ⁴​parade_location, ⁵​parade_date, ⁶​parade_order, #> #   ⁷​parade_manager

what: Obtain remarks on the evaluation process — get_remarks
title: Obtain remarks on the evaluation process — get_remarks
text: get_remarks() returns tibble remarks evaluation process year competition. may explain things : changes rules, substitution judges absence demotion schools.

title: Obtain remarks on the evaluation process — get_remarks
code: get_remarks(years)

title: Obtain remarks on the evaluation process — get_remarks
text: years (numeric) years remarks show. almost years since 1968 available.

title: Obtain remarks on the evaluation process — get_remarks
text: tibble. columns info (remarks) year (parade year). line corresponds remarks made given year.

title: Obtain remarks on the evaluation process — get_remarks
code: # Prints a table that shows the remarks on the evaluation process of 1970 and 1980 get_remarks(years = c(1970, 1980)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   info                                                                      year #>   <chr>                                                                    <int> #> 1 "Os quesitos Bateria, Harmonia e Melodia e Mestre-Sala e Porta-Bandeira…  1970 #> 2 "Nenhuma observação sobre a apuração registrada."                         1980

what: Obtain scores of samba schools by year, school and/or criterion — get_scores
title: Obtain scores of samba schools by year, school and/or criterion — get_scores
text: get_scores() returns tibble scores samba schools. can filtered year, school /criterion

title: Obtain scores of samba schools by year, school and/or criterion — get_scores
code: get_scores(years, schools = "all", criterions = "all")

title: Obtain scores of samba schools by year, school and/or criterion — get_scores
text: years (numeric) years parade show. almost years since 1968 available. schools (character) samba schools show. Case insensitive. criterions (character) evaluation criteria show. Case insensitive.

title: Obtain scores of samba schools by year, school and/or criterion — get_scores
text: tibble. columns school (samba school name), year (parade year), score (samba school score), criteria (evaluation criteria), judge_name (judge name), judge_number (judge id). line corresponds score given judge samba school criteria given year.

title: Obtain scores of samba schools by year, school and/or criterion — get_scores
text: competition changed lot years, thus list schools criteria, well range scores varies years. remarks get_remarks() good source better understanding dynamics competition.

title: Obtain scores of samba schools by year, school and/or criterion — get_scores
code: # Prints a table that shows the scores of Portela and # Estácio de Sá on the parades of 1968 and 1970 on all criterions get_scores(years = c(1968, 1970), schools = c("portela", "Estácio de Sá")) #> # A tibble: 52 × 6 #>    school         year score criteria                 judge_name         judge…¹ #>    <chr>         <dbl> <dbl> <chr>                    <chr>              <glue>  #>  1 Estácio de Sá  1968     6 ALEGORIAS E ADEREÇOS     Napoleão Muniz Fr… judge1  #>  2 Portela        1968    10 ALEGORIAS E ADEREÇOS     Napoleão Muniz Fr… judge1  #>  3 Estácio de Sá  1968     7 BATERIA                  João de Barros  B… judge1  #>  4 Portela        1968     9 BATERIA                  João de Barros  B… judge1  #>  5 Estácio de Sá  1968     7 COMISSÃO DE FRENTE       Danúbio Menezes G… judge1  #>  6 Portela        1968     9 COMISSÃO DE FRENTE       Danúbio Menezes G… judge1  #>  7 Estácio de Sá  1968     4 CONJUNTO                 Ítalo de Oliveira  judge1  #>  8 Portela        1968     4 CONJUNTO                 Ítalo de Oliveira  judge1  #>  9 Estácio de Sá  1968     4 DESFILE NÃO INTERROMPIDO Maurício Shermann  judge1  #> 10 Estácio de Sá  1968     2 DESFILE NÃO INTERROMPIDO Sandra Dicken      judge2  #> # … with 42 more rows, and abbreviated variable name ¹​judge_number

title: Generate Samba Schools palettes — rio_paletter
text: Color palettes inspired shields Carioca Samba Schools. Complete list palette colors shields inspired can found Github. Use colorblind_friendly() check whether palettes colorblind-friendly.

title: Generate Samba Schools palettes — rio_paletter
code: rio_paletter(   palette_name,   n,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   direction = c(1, -1),   override.order = FALSE )

title: Generate Samba Schools palettes — rio_paletter
text: palette_name Name Palette. Choices : Beija_Flor, Grande_Rio, Imperatriz_Leopoldinense, Imperio_Serrano, Mangueira, Padre_Miguel, Paraiso_Tuiuti, Portela, Salgueiro, Sao_Clemente, Tijuca, Uniao_Ilha, Vila_Isabel, Viradouro. n Number desired colors. number requested colors beyond scope palette, colors automatically interpolated. n provided, length palette used. type Either "continuous" "discrete". Use continuous want automatically interpolate colors. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed override.order Colors picked palette maximize readability aesthetics. means colors always selected sequential order full palette. override.order set TRUE, colors selected sequential order full palette instead. Default FALSE.

title: Generate Samba Schools palettes — rio_paletter
text: vector colors.

title: Generate Samba Schools palettes — rio_paletter
code: # Shows the Beija Flor palette rio_paletter("Beija_Flor")   # Shows the Grande Rio palette in the reverse direction rio_paletter("Grande_Rio", direction=-1)   # Shows four colors of the São Clemente palette in the print order rio_paletter("Sao_Clemente", 4, override.order=TRUE)   # Gets the scores of Império Serrano, Mangueira and Padre Miguel # from 1968 until 2018 on the Bateria criterion. # Throws some warnings to inform the user which years are absent of the data # (either from missing info or because the school didn't compete in the main league) df <- get_scores(years = 1968:2018,                  schools = c("Império Serrano",                              "Estação primeira de Mangueira",                              "Mocidade independente de Padre Miguel"),                  criterions = "BATERIA") #> Warning: Your selection does not contains: 1982, 1983, 1984  # Loads ggplot2 and dplyr library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # Creates a plot and applies manually the palette of Império Serrano df |>   filter(school == "Império Serrano") |>   ggplot(aes(x = judge_number, y = score, fill = judge_number)) +     geom_violin() +     scale_fill_manual(values = rio_paletter("Imperio_Serrano", 5))   # Creates a plot and applies manually three colors from the palette of Mangueira df |>   filter(school == "Estação Primeira de Mangueira") |>   mutate(era = case_when(       between(year, 1968, 1984) ~ "1968-1984",       between(year, 1985, 2001) ~ "1985-2001",       between(year, 2002, 2018) ~ "2002-2018"   )) |>   ggplot(aes(x = era, y = score, color = era)) +     geom_jitter() +     scale_color_manual(values = rio_paletter("Mangueira", 3))   # Creates a plot and applies manually a gradient inspired by the palette of Padre Miguel df |>   filter(school == "Mocidade Independente de Padre Miguel") |>   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = score, fill = score)) +     geom_point(color = "black", shape = 21, size = 2) +     scale_fill_gradientn(colors = rio_paletter("Padre_Miguel"))

what: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_c
title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_c
text: Function using RioPalettes colors schemes ggplot2. Use scale_color_rio_d() scale_fill_rio_d() discrete scales scale_color_rio_c() scale_fill_rio_c() continuous scales.

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_c
code: scale_color_rio_c(palette_name, direction = 1, ...)

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_c
text: palette_name Name Palette. Choices : Beija_Flor, Grande_Rio, Imperatriz_Leopoldinense, Imperio_Serrano, Mangueira, Padre_Miguel, Paraiso_Tuiuti, Portela, Salgueiro, Sao_Clemente, Tijuca, Uniao_Ilha, Vila_Isabel, Viradouro. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed ... arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradientn()

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_c
code: # Gets the scores of Salgueiro from 1968 until 2018 on the Bateria criterion. # Throws some warnings to inform the user which years are absent of the data # (either from missing info or because the school didn't compete in the main league) df <- get_scores(years = 1968:2018,                  schools = "Acadêmicos do Salgueiro",                  criterions = "BATERIA") #> Warning: Your selection does not contains: 1982, 1983, 1984  # Loads ggplot2 library(ggplot2)  # Creates a plot and applies the palette of Salgueiro df |>   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = score, color = score)) +     geom_point() +     scale_color_rio_c("Salgueiro")

what: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_d
title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_d
text: Function using RioPalettes colors schemes ggplot2. Use scale_color_rio_d() scale_fill_rio_d() discrete scales scale_color_rio_c() scale_fill_rio_c() continuous scales.

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_d
code: scale_color_rio_d(palette_name, direction = 1, override.order = FALSE, ...)

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_d
text: palette_name Name Palette. Choices : Beija_Flor, Grande_Rio, Imperatriz_Leopoldinense, Imperio_Serrano, Mangueira, Padre_Miguel, Paraiso_Tuiuti, Portela, Salgueiro, Sao_Clemente, Tijuca, Uniao_Ilha, Vila_Isabel, Viradouro. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed override.order Colors picked palette maximize readability. means colors always selected sequential order full palette. override.order set TRUE, colors selected sequential order full palette instead. Default FALSE. ... arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale()

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_rio_d
code: # Gets the scores of Mangueira from 1968 until 2018 on the Bateria criterion. # Throws some warnings to inform the user which years are absent of the data # (either from missing info or because the school didn't compete in the main league) df <- get_scores(years = 1968:2018,                  schools = "Estação primeira de Mangueira",                  criterions = "BATERIA") #> Warning: Your selection does not contains: 1982, 1983, 1984  # Loads ggplot2 and dplyr library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # Creates a plot and applies the palette of Mangueira df |>   mutate(era = case_when(       between(year, 1968, 1984) ~ "1968-1984",       between(year, 1985, 2001) ~ "1985-2001",       between(year, 2002, 2018) ~ "2002-2018"   )) |>   ggplot(aes(x = era, y = score, color = era)) +     geom_jitter() +     scale_color_rio_d("Mangueira")

Choices : Beija_Flor, Grande_Rio, Imperatriz_Leopoldinense, Imperio_Serrano, Mangueira, Padre_Miguel, Paraiso_Tuiuti, Portela, Salgueiro, Sao_Clemente, Tijuca, Uniao_Ilha, Vila_Isabel, Viradouro. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed ... arguments passed ggplot2::scale_fill_gradientn()

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_fill_rio_c
code: # Gets the scores of União da Ilha from 1968 until 2018 on the Bateria criterion. # Throws some warnings to inform the user which years are absent of the data # (either from missing info or because the school didn't compete in the main league) df <- get_scores(years = 1968:2018,                  schools = "União da Ilha do Governador",                  criterions = "BATERIA") #> Warning: Your selection does not contains: 1968, 1969, 1970, 1971, 1972, 1973, 1974, 1982, 1983, 1984, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, 2011  # Loads ggplot2 library(ggplot2)  # Creates a plot and applies the palette of União da Ilha df |>   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = score, fill = score)) +     geom_point(color = "black", shape = 21, size = 2) +     scale_fill_rio_c("Uniao_Ilha")

what: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_fill_rio_d
title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_fill_rio_d
text: Function using RioPalettes colors schemes ggplot2. Use scale_color_rio_d() scale_fill_rio_d() discrete scales scale_color_rio_c() scale_fill_rio_c() continuous scales.

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_fill_rio_d
code: scale_fill_rio_d(palette_name, direction = 1, override.order = FALSE, ...)

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_fill_rio_d
text: palette_name Name Palette. Choices : Beija_Flor, Grande_Rio, Imperatriz_Leopoldinense, Imperio_Serrano, Mangueira, Padre_Miguel, Paraiso_Tuiuti, Portela, Salgueiro, Sao_Clemente, Tijuca, Uniao_Ilha, Vila_Isabel, Viradouro. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed override.order Colors picked palette maximize readability. means colors always selected sequential order full palette. override.order set TRUE, colors selected sequential order full palette instead. Default FALSE. ... arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale()

title: RioPaletter palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_fill_rio_d
code: # Gets the scores of Grande Rio from 1968 until 2018 on the Bateria criterion. # Throws some warnings to inform the user which years are absent of the data # (either from missing info or because the school didn't compete in the main league) df <- get_scores(years = 1968:2018,                  schools = "Acadêmicos do Grande Rio",                  criterions = "BATERIA") #> Warning: Your selection does not contains: 1968, 1969, 1970, 1971, 1972, 1973, 1974, 1975, 1976, 1977, 1978, 1979, 1980, 1981, 1982, 1983, 1984, 1985, 1986, 1987, 1988, 1989, 1990, 1992, 2011  # Loads ggplot2 and dplyr library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # Creates a plot and applies the palette of Grande Rio df |>   mutate(era = case_when(       between(year, 1991, 2004) ~ "1991-2004",       between(year, 2005, 2018) ~ "2005-2018"   )) |>   ggplot(aes(x = era, y = score, fill = era)) +     geom_violin() +     scale_fill_rio_d("Grande_Rio")
